intro: Catabrosa capusii, commonly known as the Cape catabrosa, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Catabrosa capusii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
